summarization.results: Chastity is highlighted as a virtue applicable to all, involving self-mastery over passions and integrating sexuality into humanity. It is distinct from celibacy, which consecrates one's sexuality to the Lord for union with God and as a witness to the heavenly marriage. Celibacy and continence are linked to contemplative life and union with Christ, emphasizing a spousal commitment to love in a nuptial way. The historical practice of celibacy and continence in the early church is discussed, with references to figures like Paul and Peter, alongside reassurance regarding the Hebrew word "Shemar."
